Name: Zurich
Description: The financial and cultural hub of Switzerland, known for its historic Old Town and proximity to Lake Zurich.

Name: Bern
Description: The capital of Switzerland, with a medieval old town and a center of Swiss politics and governance.

Name: Geneva
Description: Known for its international organizations, including the UN and Red Cross, as well as its scenic location along Lake Geneva.

Name: Vaud
Description: Located on the western shore of Lake Geneva, famous for its vineyards, historical towns, and as the location of Lausanne.

Name: Lucerne
Description: A region with a rich cultural heritage, known for its picturesque lakeside city of Lucerne, surrounded by mountains.

Name: Aargau
Description: Known for its medieval towns, castles, and rolling hills, it is located in the central part of Switzerland.

Name: St. Gallen
Description: Located in the eastern part of Switzerland, known for its historic abbey and the beautiful Appenzell Alps.

Name: Ticino
Description: The Italian-speaking region of Switzerland, famous for its Mediterranean climate, mountains, and lakes, including Lake Lugano.

Name: Graub√ºnden
Description: Known for its alpine beauty and outdoor activities, it is home to famous resorts like St. Moritz and Davos.

Name: Thurgau
Description: Located along the shores of Lake Constance, known for its apple orchards and quaint towns.

Name: Solothurn
Description: A region with a rich Baroque heritage, known for the city of Solothurn, which features many historic buildings and churches.

Name: Basel-Landschaft
Description: A region located to the north of Switzerland, known for its proximity to France and Germany, and its historic towns and nature.

Name: Basel-Stadt
Description: Known for the city of Basel, a cultural and economic center, home to many international pharmaceutical companies.

Name: Obwalden
Description: A small central region known for its beautiful alpine scenery and traditional Swiss villages.

Name: Nidwalden
Description: A mountainous region with scenic views, famous for the lake of Lucerne and Mount Pilatus.

Name: Uri
Description: A mountainous region with historic towns, known for the Gotthard Pass and as the birthplace of the Swiss Confederation.

Name: Appenzell Innerrhoden
Description: Known for its well-preserved traditions and its location in the foothills of the Alps, it has a strong sense of local identity.

Name: Appenzell Ausserrhoden
Description: The region surrounding Appenzell, famous for its picturesque villages, dairy farming, and hiking trails.
